title: Firefox 18.0a2 Aurora

notes.note: Faster JavaScript performance via IonMonkey compiler
Support for Retina Display on OS X 10.7 and up
Disable insecure content loading on HTTPS pages through an about:config pref
Starting Firefox with -private flag incorrectly claims you are not in Private Browsing mode
Plugins stop rendering when the top half of the plugin is scrolled off the top of the page, in HiDPI mode

Certain valid WebGL drawing operations are incorrectly rejected,
leaving incomplete rendering in affected pages
Experience better image quality with our new HTML scaling algorithm
Support for W3C touch events implemented, taking the place of MozTouch events
Support for new DOM property window.devicePixelRatio
Improvement in startup time through smart handling of signed extension certificates
18.0.1 Problems involving HTTP Proxy Transactions (bug 828632,bug 828202,bug 828202,bug 829646,)
18.0.1 Unity player crashes on Mac OS X (bug 828954)
18.0.1 Disabled HIDPI support only on external monitors to avoid rendering glitches (bug 814434)
Improved responsiveness for users on proxies

If you try to start Firefox using a locked profile, it will crash (see [573369][1])


  [1]: http://bugzilla.mozilla.org/573369

system_requirements:
Windows

Operating Systems
  • Windows XP SP2
  • Windows Server 2003
  • Windows Vista
  • Windows 7
  • Windows 8

Please note that while the 32-bit and 64-bit versions of Windows Vista and Windows 7 can be used to run Firefox 18, only 32-bit builds of Firefox 18 are supported at this time.

Recommended Hardware
  • Pentium 4 or newer processor that supports SSE2
  • 512MB of RAM
  • 200MB of hard drive space

Mac

Operating Systems
  • Mac OS X 10.6
  • Mac OS X 10.7
Recommended Hardware
  • Macintosh computer with an Intel x86 processor
  • 512 MB of RAM
  • 200 MB hard drive space

Linux

Software Requirements

Please note that Linux distributors may provide packages for your distribution which have different requirements.

  • Firefox will not run at all without the following libraries or packages:
    • GTK+ 2.10 or higher
    • GLib 2.12 or higher
    • Pango 1.14 or higher
    • X.Org 1.0 or higher (1.7 or higher is recommended)
    • libstdc++ 4.3 or higher
  • For optimal functionality, we recommend the following libraries or packages:
    • NetworkManager 0.7 or higher
    • DBus 1.0 or higher
    • HAL 0.5.8 or higher
    • GNOME 2.16 or higher
